posts.name: Abdul Kavi Chaudhary
posts.cooked:
My Quiz ID is Berlin:200

For all the numerical questions in my TDS project 1, Answer on clicking Check, comes out to be wrong, when i used python to calculate first, then calculated it manually and then used gpt too to confirm, all the answers are same, but in my project if i put that answer and click check it comes out to be wrong?!

posts.name: Rajat Goel
posts.cooked: The only reason can be that you have the wrong data

posts.name: Abdul Kavi Chaudhary
posts.cooked: No for Rest of the questions answer is correct.

posts.name: Rishit Pant
posts.cooked: Make sure you followed this. I had the same issue but after changing null values to '' and booleans to true and false, I was able to answer.

link_counts.title: Wrong Answer for Q11, Q12, Q13, Q15 in TDS-PROJECT-1

posts.name: Pradeep Kumar P
posts.cooked:
For booleans is it ‘true’ and ‘false’ as string?

i tried this too, i still get error for this

posts.name: Saloni Singh
posts.cooked:
Hey I have the same issue. I tried changing to true and false and '', but am still getting incorrect answers.
Can you let me know how you replaced these values? in excel or by using python?

posts.name: Rishit Pant
posts.cooked: Sorry, I didn’t mean that. If you are using csv.writer for when writing to the CSV, it automatically converts these boolean values to their string representations ("True" or "False"), so they’ll appear as text in the CSV file. So, you might need to use astype(bool) then try.

posts.name: Pradeep Kumar P
posts.cooked: in colab im able to calculate the result, however concern is with the format expected in csv file. i now write it as true false format in lowercase string. still my answers are shown wrong. My question ID is Berlin:200

posts.name: Soubhagya Nayak
posts.cooked: bro can you share your code for scrapping
